entries: At 18th level, when you finish a long rest you can choose to replace one compound you know with another one.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Leaden Crown
entries: In contrast to the esoteric ideals of other monastic traditions, monks of the Way of the Leaden Crown have practical aims: the self-governance of humanoid peoples. These monks see the history of the world as a series of clashes between groups of powerful beings, where humanoids were at best collateral damage and at worst disposable pawns. To break this cycle of dependence and destruction, monks of the Way of the Leaden Crown master mental powers to fight back against the otherworldly powers of the multiverse and protect humanoid sovereignty.

One component of this plan involves training to do battle with powerful outsiders. The other equally important component is ensuring that humanoid societies are prepared to overthrow those powerful outsiders already dominating them. To that end, these monks seek political positions that place them in or near decision-making roles where they can influence humanoids to fight back against arch seraphs, arch daemons, and primordials.

subclassFeature.name: Subtle Hand
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your martial arts are enhanced by a capacity for telekinetic strikes. On your turn your reach is 10 feet when you make unarmed attacks. In addition, when you make an unarmed strike this way, it deals force damage instead.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Prowess
entries: Also at 3rd level, your psychic powers have manifested in the ability to cast certain spells. You gain the {@spell mage hand} cantrip if you don't already know it. When you cast the spell, the spectral hand is {@condition invisible}.

In addition, you can cast certain spells by expending ki. You can use an action and spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell detect evil and good} or {@spell protection from evil and good.} You can also use an action and spend 2 kit points to cast {@spell hold person}, {@spell levitate}, or {@spell shatter}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells and you do not need to provide material components when casting them in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Unsubtle Strike
entries: At 6th level, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or monk weapon, you can force it to make a Strength saving throw against your ki save DC. On a failure, you can choose to push or pull the creature 10 feet. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Crush
entries: Starting at 11th level, each time you hit a creature with an unarmed strike it gains a pressure point. A creature loses all pressure points if you give a different creature a pressure point or 1 minute after the last time it gained a pressure point. As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki points to telekinetically crush a creature with 1 or more of your pressure points.

When you do, the creature must make a Strength saving throw against your ki save DC. On a failure, the creature takes {@dice 1d8} force damage per pressure point they have and they are {@condition restrained} until the end of your next turn. On a success, they take half as much damage and aren't {@condition restrained}. Either way, the creature then loses all pressure points.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Mastery
entries: At 17th level, you have mastered the psionic disciplines necessary to defend mortals from outsiders. As an action, you can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell dispel evil and good}, {@spell hold monster}, {@spell telekinesis}, or {@spell wall of force}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells and you do not need to provide material components when casting them in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Way of Pride
entries: Monks of the Way of Pride value themselves above all others. These monks focus on mastering their form, ego, and destructive power. They use their monastic traditions publicly, with the intention of gaining the respect and admiration of "lesser beings."
The prideful traditions of this order include adorning oneself with jewelry, hiding their scars from prying eyes, and commanding respect from those that would oppose them.

subclassFeature.name: Tall Tales
entries: At 3rd level, you have gained a knack for telling embellished tales of your past achievements. You gain proficiency in your choice of one of the following skills: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Performance}, and {@skill Persuasion}.

subclassFeature.name: Bruised Ego
entries: At 3rd level, your ego bolsters your vitality, strengthening as you fight to prove your vigor. Whenever you expend a ki point, you can also choose to gain temporary hit points equal to your Proficiency Bonus. While your current hit points are equal to or less than half your maximum hit points, you can also add your Wisdom modifier to the amount of temporary hit points gained.

subclassFeature.name: Assertive Attacker
entries: At 3rd level, while your current hit points are equal to or less than half your maximum hit points, your Martial Arts die counts as being one higher than normal.
For example, if you are a 6th-level monk, your Martial Arts die goes from a {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8}. At 17th level and higher you Martial Arts die goes from a {@dice d10} to a {@dice d12}.

subclassFeature.name: Irrational Retaliation
entries: Beginning at 6th level, damage dealt to you is damage dealt to your pride, and that is something you simply cannot allow. Whenever a creature deals damage to you, you can use your reaction to expend 2 ki points to target that creature. Until the end of your next turn, all attacks you make against the target creature have advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Redoubled Efforts
entries: Additionally at 6th level, while your current hit points are equal to or less than half your maximum hit points, you can roll one additional Martial Arts die when determining the extra damage dealt by a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Ever Prideful
entries: At 11th level, your muscle memory takes over. When your hit points are reduced to 0 you are not knocked {@condition unconscious}, but you must still make death saving throws and suffer all the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points. At the beginning of each of your turns whilst in this state you can spend 1 ki point to remain in this state. If you do not spend a ki point at the start of your turn whilst at 0 hit points you suffer all the normal effects of being reduced to 0 hit points.
The following also apply:

items: You cannot speak.
You cannot cast or concentrate on spells.
Critical hits against you count as one failed death saving throw instead of 2.

subclassFeature.name: Egotistical
entries: Beginning at 17th level, you gain the benefits of this class' features that state ‘while your current hit points are equal to or less than half your maximum hit points' whenever you are below your hit point maximum instead, provided you have been damaged by a hostile creature within the past minute.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Pestilence
entries: Clad in grime-soaked armor and wielding rusting weapons, the Oath of Pestilence paladin spreads corruption, disease, and filth. Bound by an oath which infests their bodies with all manner of plagues, these heralds of decay lumber forward with unholy toughness and grim resolve.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Pestilence
entries: The tenets of the Oath of Pestilence emphasize the role of disease as a purifying element in the cycle of life.

entries.name: Strength in Resilience
entries: Surviving hardship and plague make you stronger. Spreading these things causes strength to flourish.

entries.name: All Things Must Pass
entries: Death is the natural conclusion of life. There is nothing unnatural or amoral about the ending of life.

entries.name: Might Makes Right
entries: The laws of mortals mean nothing to poxes and plagues, they go where they wish and take what they want. So should you.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of Pestilence Spells table. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how oath spells work.

rows: {@spell melf's acid arrow}, {@spell ray of enfeeblement}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Divinity options:

entries.name: Debilitating Fever
entries: Your touch inflicts disease. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach that isn't a construct or undead. On a hit, the creature becomes diseased and is {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. At the end of each of the diseased target's turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the target is no longer diseased, and the effect ends.
Since this ability induces a natural disease in its target, any effect that removes a disease or otherwise ameliorates a disease's effects apply to it.

entries.name: Entropic Infection
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to weaken a creature against entropic energies. As an action, you can force a creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, for the next minute the creature takes an additional {@dice 2d6} damage the first time it takes necrotic damage each turn. During this time, the creature loses resistance to necrotic damage if it has it.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Rampant Sickness
entries: Starting at 7th level, you emit an aura of contagion and virulence to a range of 10 feet. When a creature within your aura makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw you can give that roll disadvantage as a reaction. Once you do, you can't give another roll disadvantage using this feature until the start of your next turn.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Disgusting Resilience
entries: At 15th level, when you take damage which would reduce you to 0 hit points, you can choose to expend any number of hit dice. Roll those dice and subtract the result from the damage taken. If this reduces the damage to 0, you don't take any damage.

In addition, if you are killed your corpse violently explodes in a shower of pus and gore, dealing {@dice 8d6} necrotic damage to creatures within 20 feet of you that fail a Constitution saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Plaguebringer
entries: At 20th level, you become an avatar of plague, which gives you the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to necrotic damage and are immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.
Your hit point maximum can't be reduced.

entries: Creatures of your choice who start their turn within 5 feet of you, or who move within 5 feet of you on their turn, take necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier. Once a creature takes damage from this ability, it can't take damage from it again until the start of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Zeal
entries: The Oath of Zeal is taken by paladins consumed by hatred for a specific group or ideology. Zealots, as these paladins are sometimes called, pursue an inquisition against their enemies at all costs. They abandon compassion and honor as impediments to the more important work of ridding the world of those they deem dangerous or heretical.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Zeal
entries: The tenets of the Oath of Zeal are serious and severe, as are those paladins who choose to take them.

entries.name: Uncover Corruption
entries: Darkness cannot abide the light of day. Wickedness must be revealed before it can be destroyed.

entries.name: Purge the Heretics
entries: Heresy is a tumor that spread through the hearts of the innocent. Cut it out at the source.

entries.name: No Mercy
entries: The righteous path requires unwavering conviction and unflinching resolve.

entries.name: By Any Means Necessary
entries: There is no sacrifice too great when it comes to defeating the wicked.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of Zeal Spells table. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how oath spells work.

rows: {@spell detect evil and good}, {@spell hunter's mark}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options:

entries.name: Mark of the Heretic
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to mark a creature as a heretic. As a bonus action, choose a creature you can see within 30 feet and a weeping symbol appears on it. For the next minute, your weapon attacks against the chosen creature score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, and each time the creature's turn starts you can use your reaction to make one weapon attack against it.

entries.name: Inquisitor's Eye
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to open your senses to hidden signs of corruption and malfeasance. As a bonus action, you grant yourself advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}), Wisdom ({@skill Insight}), and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) ability checks for the next 10 minutes. During this time, you can't be surprised.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Clarity
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be {@condition blinded} while you are conscious. Additionally, creatures and objects of your choice within this range can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Compel Confession
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can cast the {@spell zone of truth} spell without expending a spell slot. When you cast the spell with this feature, creatures who succeed on their saving throw take {@condition 1d4} psychic damage at the start of each of their turns while they remain within the affected area.

subclassFeature.name: Apocalyptic Revelation
entries: At 20th level, as an action you can reveal the true nature of your enemies to all for 1 minute. During this time, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@sense truesight} out to a distance of 120 feet.

Creatures who start their turn, or move within, 5 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw against your paladin spell save DC. On a failure, the creature is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

As a bonus action on each of your turns you can choose a creature within 60 feet and reveal its weaknesses for all to see. Attacks made against the chosen creature have advantage until the start of your next turn.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Green Reaper
entries: Green Reapers specialize in a school of assassination that specializes in harvesting and catalyzing the toxic elements of flora and fauna. These rangers often work as killers for hire utilizing their extensive knowledge of toxins to end their marks' lives discreetly or with gory panache, depending on the poison used and the client's wishes. Green Reapers exhibit a morbid curiosity when encountering a toxic substance they're unfamiliar with, typically followed by an enthusiastic application of the toxin on the next foe they encounter.

subclassFeature.name: Green Reaper Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Green Reaper Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Envenomed Attack
entries: At 3rd level, you can use your {@item poisoner's kit|phb} as a bonus action to coat a weapon or up to 20 pieces of ammunition with a dose of toxic poison. For the next minute, each time you deal damage with the weapon or ammunition, you deal an additional {@dice 1d4} poison damage. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and expended uses of this feature are recovered at the end of a long rest.
At 11th level, this additional damage increases to {@dice 2d4}. Also, the expended uses of this feature are recovered at the end of a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Toxic Tradecraft
entries: Also at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item poisoner's kit|phb}. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check that uses this proficiency. Additionally, when you gain this feature, you also gain a poisoner's kit. If you ever lose this kit, you can spend 8 hours creating a replacement by collecting toxic flora and harvesting venomous fauna.

As a final benefit of this feature, once per turn when you hit a creature with a weapon or ammunition enhanced by your Envenomed Attack feature, you can spend a spell slot to apply a magical toxin to the attack. The toxin deals an additional {@dice 1d6} poison damage and the creature is {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn. The toxin has additional effects based on the spell slot expended casting the spell. These additional effects are detailed at the end of this subclass description under Toxin Effects.

subclassFeature.name: 1st-Level Effects
entries: When you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to create a toxin, choose one of the following effects to add to the toxin.

entries.name: Attenuate
entries: While a creature is poisoned by this toxin, it has disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Befuddled
entries: While a creature is poisoned by this toxin, it cannot speak, read, or write any language and it has disadvantage on saving throws made to maintain concentration on spells.

entries.name: Uncoordinated
entries: While a creature is poisoned by this toxin, it cannot take reactions or the {@action Disengage} or {@action Dodge} action.

subclassFeature.name: 2nd-Level Effects
entries: When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher to create a toxin, choose one of the following effects to add to the toxin.

entries.name: Debilitate
entries: The creature can't regain hit points for the next minute.

entries.name: Potent
entries: If the creature has resistance to poison damage, it loses that resistance for the next minute.

entries.name: Suffer
entries: For the next minute, the first time the creature takes poison damage each turn it takes an additional {@dice 1d6} poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: 3rd-Level Effects
entries: When you expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher to create a toxin, choose one of the following effects to add to the toxin.

entries.name: Lingering
entries: Instead of ending at the end of your next turn, the creature continues to be {@condition poisoned} for 10 minutes. At the end of each of the creature's turns it can make a Constitution saving throw using your ranger spell save DC. If the creature accumulates three successes, which do not have to be consecutive, the {@condition poisoned} condition ends early.

entries.name: Supernatural
entries: When you deal damage with a weapon attack that has been dosed with this toxin, the creature loses immunity to the {@condition poisoned} condition if it has such an immunity. In addition, instead of ending at the end of your next turn, the creature continues to be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. At the end of each of the creature's turns it can make a Constitution saving throw using your ranger spell save DC, ending the condition on a success.

subclassFeature.name: 4th-Level Effects
entries: When you expend a spell slot of 4th level or higher to create a toxin, choose one of the following effects to add to the toxin.

entries.name: Flesh Eating
entries: While a creature is poisoned by this toxin, it takes {@dice 2d6} acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Insensate
entries: While a creature is poisoned by this toxin, it is also {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}.

entries.name: Paraplegia
entries: While a creature is poisoned by this toxin, its movement speeds become 0 and it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: 5th-Level Effects
entries: When you expend a spell slot of 5th level or higher to create a toxin, choose one of the following effects to add to the toxin.

entries.name: Enhanced
entries: Choose an additional option for this toxin off of the 4th level effects list and another additional option off of the 1st or 2nd level effects list.

entries.name: Insensate
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack that used this toxin, the attack deals an additional {@dice 5d6} damage. This additional damage's type is your choice of acid, necrotic, or poison.

subclassFeature.name: Poison Control
entries: At 7th level, you gain resistance to poison damage and have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

In addition, you can cast the {@spell protection from poison} spell without expending a spell slot. You can do so a number of times up to your Wisdom modifier, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Variegated Vexations
entries: At 11th level, when you apply the toxin granted by your Envenomed Attack feature, you can choose to change the additional damage to acid or necrotic instead of poison.

subclassFeature.name: Pain Tolerance
entries: At 15th level, you've learned to quickly inure yourself against harm. After you take damage from an attack, you can use your reaction to gain temporary hit points equal to the damage. You lose all temporary hit points gained from this feature at the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Vermin Lord
entries: Vermin Lords cultivate loyal hordes of disease-bearing rodents to help them in their efforts to stem a greater evil. For many of these rangers, that greater evil is some kind of societal ill, but a rare few see their fellow humanoids as an infestation that threatens the natural world. Regardless of their goal, they make their homes in sewers, slums, and other forgotten places, where they are free to plot against their enemies and tend to their vermin kin.

subclassFeature.name: Vermin Lord Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Vermin Lord Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Verminkin
entries: At 3rd level, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with vermin (mice, rats, and other rodents determined by your DM).

Additionally, you can use an action and expend a spell slot to summon rodent hordes. When you do, you summon a number of {@creature swarms of vermin|GHPG} equal to twice the level of spell slot expended. Each swarm is summoned to a space you can see within 30 feet.

Swarms summoned in this way go on your initiative, starting on your next turn. These swarms obey your verbal commands (no action required by you), defending themselves by taking the {@action Dodge} action if you do not give them a command. Your vermin swarms flee the area and disperse after 10 minutes or when you use this feature to summon other swarms of vermin.

subclassFeature.name: Septic Strikes
entries: At 3rd level, you leave a septic filth behind to fester in the wounds caused by your and your verminkin's attacks. As a bonus action, you can choose any number of creatures within 60 feet of you that took damage from a weapon attack made by you or your swarm of vermin this turn. Chosen creatures take {@dice 1d4} necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Filth and Fortitude
entries: By 7th level, the time you've spent with plaguebearing rodents has rendered you immune to disease. Additionally, you gain proficiency with Constitution saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Infectious Spread
entries: At 11th level, when you use your bonus action to deal the damage granted by your Septic Strikes feature, each creature that takes damage must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to your ranger spell save DC. On a failure, the creature becomes {@condition poisoned} until the start of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once). You regain all expended uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Strength of the Swarm
entries: At 15th level, while you have a swarm of vermin summoned with your Verminkin feature, you can call on your rodent minions for defense. When you take damage while one or more of your swarms of rats are within 5 feet, you can use your reaction and choose one of those swarms to take the damage instead.

subclassFeature.name: Highway Rider
entries: Stalking the backroads, the Highway Rider strikes fear into the heart of every traveler and penny-pinching merchant. They run down their prize astride a swift and loyal steed–and then make a quick getaway.

subclassFeature.name: Hair Trigger
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you roll for initiative, you can immediately use your reaction to take one of the following actions:

items: Make one weapon attack with advantage
Move your speed, or your mount's speed, without provoking opportunity attacks
Take the {@action Dodge} action
Interact with an object or use an item

subclassFeature.name: Trusty Mount
entries: At 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell find steed} spell. When you do, its creature type remains beast rather than changing to your choice of celestial, fey, or fiend. Once you cast this spell using this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Ride Them Down
entries: Also at 3rd level, you gain an additional way to use your Sneak Attack: you don't need advantage on the attack roll to use your Sneak Attack against a creature if you or your mount moved at least 20 feet this turn, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll. All the other rules for Sneak Attack still apply.

subclassFeature.name: Horse Lord
entries: At 9th level, you can spend a minute grooming and caring for your mount, at the end of which time it gains temporary hit points equal to twice your level in this class.
In addition, your cunning extends to your steed. While you are controlling a mount, it can spend a bonus action on its turn to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Dodge} action.

subclassFeature.name: True Grit
entries: At 13th level, you gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws. In addition, when you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Constitution saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

subclassFeature.name: Desperado
entries: Starting at 17th level, when you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to take one of the actions listed in your Hair Trigger feature immediately before you fall {@condition unconscious}.

subclassFeature.name: Misfortune Bringer
entries: You've matched your penchant for illicit activities with the ability to mark your enemies for mishaps and misfortune. Whether your mother was a hag, you were imbued with magical powers by spending time among the fey, or you learned the art of cursing from a long line of hedge wizards before you, you are a Misfortune Bringer. Although not universal, many Misfortune Bringers have eyes of two different colors, using only one when glaring at the targets they intend to curse.

subclassFeature.name: Evil Eye
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the ability to place a minor curse on others with a glance. As a bonus action on your turn, choose a creature you can see within 60 feet. The chosen creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your misfortune save DC or be marked by your evil eye. While a creature is marked by your evil eye, you can use your Sneak Attack against the creature even if you don't have advantage on the attack roll, but not if you have disadvantage on it.
The creature remains marked by your evil eye for 1 minute or until you mark a different creature with your evil eye, whichever comes first.

subclassFeature.name: Misfortunist
entries: Also at 3rd level, you learn misfortunes that you can inflict on those marked by your evil eye.

entries.name: Misfortunes
entries: You learn two misfortunes of your choice, which are detailed under "Misfortunes" below. You learn an additional misfortune of your choice at 9th, 13th, and 17th level. Each time you finish a long rest, you can replace one misfortune you know with a different one.

entries.name: Jinx Points
entries: You have three jinx points. When you spend a jinx point, it is no longer available to you until you regain it. You regain all spent jinx points when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain two additional jinx points at 13th level.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: Your evil eye, and some of your misfortunes, require your target to make a saving throw to resist their effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

subclassFeature.name: Misfortunes
entries: The misfortunes are presented in alphabetical order.

subclassFeature.name: Steal Luck
entries: Starting at 9th level, when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw with advantage, you can use your reaction to remove advantage from the roll. When you do, you regain an expended jinx point. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.
At 17th level, you can use this feature three times, regaining all uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Curse Caster
entries: At 13th level, you can use an action and spend 3 jinx points to cast the {@spell bestow curse} spell. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Jinx Points
entries: At 13th level, you gain two additional jinx points.

subclassFeature.name: Steal Luck Improvement
entries: At 17th level, you can use your Steal Luck feature three times, regaining all uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Haunted
entries: Unlike many other sorcerers, the circumstances of your birth were mundane and you have no arcane inheritance passed down from strange ancestors. Instead, you gained your sorcerous powers after you managed to survive an experience that left you on the brink of death. Since that experience you've had a preternatural sense for danger and a ghostly companion that either can't or won't leave you alone. Some Haunted, as sorcerers who share your origin are called, develop cordial relationships with their phantom, while others find their spectral companion to be a relentless nuisance.

subclassFeature.name: Haunted Spells
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Haunted Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.
When you cast a spell you know from the Haunted Spells table, you can cast it by expending a spell slot as normal or by spending a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Companion
entries: At 1st level, you learn the {@spell find familiar} spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.
When you cast the spell, you can only choose the form of a {@creature specter}, which becomes your phantom companion. Instead of a celestial, fey, or fiend this familiar's creature type is undead.

As an action, you can command your phantom companion to turn invisible until it attacks or you cast a spell through it. While invisible, it leaves no physical evidence of its passage, so it can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment or objects it is holding remains visible.
Additionally, at 3rd level, when you take the {@action Attack} action, you can forgo one of your own attacks to allow your familiar to make its Life Drain attack with its reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Sixth Sense
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you make a Dexterity ability check to determine initiative, you gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Strength of Spirit
entries: At 6th level, your bond to the specter summoned by your Phantom Companion feature empowers it further. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your specter's maximum hit points increase by four times your level in this class.
Your specter can deliver spells of any range, not just touch. Apart from this change, it follows all the normal rules of casting a spell through your familiar.
When you use your action to cast a spell, you can use a bonus action on the same turn to command your specter to use its Life Drain attack against a creature within range of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Deathly Pallor
entries: Also at 6th level, you gain resistance to necrotic damage. In addition, when you cast a sorcerer spell that deals damage, you can choose to change the damage type dealt to necrotic.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Possession
entries: At 14th level, as an action you can direct your phantom companion to attempt to possess and enter a creature of your choice within 5 feet of your phantom. When you do, the creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or be possessed by your phantom for 1 minute. During this time your phantom cannot be affected by spells or abilities, take actions, or interact with in any way.

While the target is possessed, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are within 100 feet. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability, taking the Dodge action if it has not used its action already.

Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Charisma saving throw against the possession. If the saving throw succeeds, the possession ends and your phantom companion reappears in the closest unoccupied space.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Become Death
entries: At 18th level, you can transmute your physical form into a spectral one when you near death. When you take damage that would reduce you to 0 hit points, you drop to 1 hit point instead and gain temporary hit points equal to half your maximum hit points. At the start of each of your turns, you lose 5 temporary hit points and all creatures of your choice within 30 feet take 5 necrotic damage. While you have any temporary hit points granted from this feature, you have resistance to all damage, a fly speed of 30 feet, and can move through creatures and objects provided you end your movement in an unoccupied space.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Wretched Bloodline
entries: With every promise made to a fairy, contract signed with a devil, and pact with the unquiet dead, there's a chance someone doesn't keep their end of the bargain. The vengeance of immortal beings lasts much longer than one lifetime, and the lingering magic of these curses can affect the mortal's descendants.

These inherited magical afflictions may manifest as a plague, deformity, or aversion to the sun. In such families, a child may be born that learns to master the latent magic within their inherited curse, turning their bloodline's bane into a personal boon—these sorcerers are known collectively as the Wretched.

subclassFeature.name: Bad Luck Charm
entries: Starting at 1st level, you have mastered the ability to temporarily cast a small fragment of your curse onto another. You can use a bonus action to choose a creature you can see within 30 feet. The chosen creature has disadvantage on the next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest, unless you spend 1 sorcery point to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Ties
entries: At 1st level, your senses easily attune to the supernatural forces that caused your inherited affliction. You know the {@spell detect evil and good} spell and can cast it without expending a spell slot. This spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you but does not count against your number of spells known. Once you cast this spell without expending a spell slot, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

In addition, choose one of the following creature types as the being who cursed your ancestor: fey, fiend, or undead. While you are concentrating on the {@spell detect evil and good} spell, creatures of the chosen type have disadvantage on attack rolls against you, and you cannot be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition possessed} by such creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Wretched Curse
entries: Also at 1st level, you suffer from a curse inherited from an ancestor who failed to uphold their end of a bargain with an otherworldly power. Choose one of the following curses that was passed down to you.

entries.name: Hulking
entries: Your ancestor was cursed with a hulking frame. You have disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) ability checks made to move quietly. In addition, your maximum hit points increase by 1 and increase by 1 again each time you gain a level in this class. Finally, you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Nocturnal
entries: Your ancestor was cursed to shun the light of day. You have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) ability checks made to see while you are in sunlight. In addition, you have {@sense darkvision} out to a distance of 120 feet and can see through magical darkness within that range.

entries.name: Plaguebearer
entries: Your ancestor was cursed with physical symptoms of a plague. You have disadvantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) ability checks made against humanoid creatures who are not {@condition blinded}. In addition, you are immune to disease and have resistance to necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Share the Burden
entries: At 6th level, you learn the {@spell bestow curse} spell. This spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against your number of sorcerer spells known. When you cast the spell, you can choose to cast it by spending 3 sorcery points instead of a spell slot. If you cast the spell using sorcery points, its range changes to 60 feet for that casting and your concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

subclassFeature.name: Terrifying Visage
entries: Beginning at 14th level, you can use a bonus action to adopt the terrifying visage of the being who cursed your ancestor for 10 minutes. During this time, you can use an action on each of your turns to cause each creature who can see you within 30 feet make a Wisdom saving throw against your sorcerer spell save DC. On a failure, a creature is {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.
In addition, while you have adopted the terrifying visage, you gain an additional benefit based on the creature type chosen with your Blood Ties feature.

entries.name: Fey
entries: You can use a bonus action to teleport up to 30 feet in any direction.

entries.name: Fiend
entries: You have resistance to cold and fire damage.

entries.name: Undead
entries: When you take damage that isn't radiant, you can use your reaction to reduce that damage by an amount equal to half your sorcerer level.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Summons
entries: Beginning at 18th level, your magic has become powerful enough that you can call and command a servant of those that cursed you. Choose one of the following creatures as a representative for your curse based on the choice you made with your Blood Ties feature: {@creature lamia} or {@creature troll} (fey only), {@creature barbed devil} or {@creature incubus}/{@creature succubus} (fiend only), {@creature ghost} or {@creature wraith} (undead only).

You can use an action and spend 5 sorcery points to summon your chosen creature. The creature appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet, and disappears when it drops to 0 hit points, you use this feature to summon another creature, or after 10 minutes have passed.

Roll initiative for the creature, which has its own turns. When you summon it and on each of your turns thereafter, you can issue a verbal command to it (requiring no action on your part), telling it what it must do on its next turn. If you issue no command, it spends its turn attacking any creature within reach.

subclassFeature.name: The First Vampire
entries: You have made a pact with a powerful vampire cursed by the gods or born as a creature of the night. Hundreds of haunted beings serve this vampire, so why enter a pact with you? Because you can act in the light of day unhindered? To cull weaker vampires?

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The First Vampire lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

rows: {@spell conjure animals} ({@creature bat|mm|bats}, {@creature rat|mm|rats} or {@creature wolf|mm|wolves} only), {@spell gaseous form}

subclassFeature.name: Nocturnal Predator
entries: At 1st level, as a predator of the night you have been blessed with enhanced vision in darkness. You have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, increase the range by 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Drain Life
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain an innate power to drain life from the living. When you use the Attack action or cast a spell, you can use a bonus action on the same turn to make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of you. Your attack deals necrotic damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Charisma ability modifier on a hit.

When you hit a creature with this feature, you can expend a warlock spell slot to deal an extra {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage to the target, plus another {@dice 1d8} per level of the spell slot. When you expend a spell slot to enhance the attack in this way, you regain hit points equal to the total damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Creature of the Night
entries: At 6th level, you can use your action to cast {@spell polymorph} on yourself, transforming into a {@creature bat} or {@creature wolf}. While you are in either of these forms, you retain your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, regaining all spent uses upon completion of a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Appetite
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with your Life Drain feature, you can use your reaction to consume the last of their fleeting mortality. When you do, you regain one of your expended pact spell slots. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Night
entries: At 14th level, your vampire patron grants you a taste of true immortality. You no longer age, and you gain resistance to necrotic damage.
Additionally, once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to gain the following effects for one minute:

You regain {@dice 1d6} hit points at the start of your turn if you have at least 1 hit point and aren't in direct sunlight or running water. If you take radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of your next turn.
When using your Drain Life feature, you can use it as if you were expending a 1st-level spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: The Parasite
entries: Your patron is a cosmic parasite, draining the vitality out of whole peoples and worlds. Upon forging a pact with such a patron, you become host to one of its nascent offspring. As you grow in power, the boundary between your identity and the parasitic larva within you blurs.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Siphon
entries: Your patron has taught you to siphon magic from your enemies and make it your own. When a creature you can see within 60 feet casts a spell of a level you can cast with your pact magic spell slots, you can use your reaction to force them to make a Charisma saving throw using your warlock spell save DC. On a failure, the spell is cast as normal and you siphon the knowledge of the spell. While the spell is siphoned, the creature cannot cast the spell again and you can cast it as if it was a warlock spell you know by spending a pact spell slot as normal. Once you cast it, the spell is no longer siphoned and you no longer know the spell.

You can siphon a number of spells up to 1 + your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). If you exceed this maximum, a spell of your choice that you have previously siphoned is no longer siphoned. A spell is no longer siphoned if you go unconscious or die.

subclassFeature.name: Physical Specimen
entries: Starting at 1st level, your patron has enhanced your physical form to improve your utility as a host and pawn. When you finish a long rest, choose a number of the following benefits up to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). You gain these benefits until your next long rest.

items: Your maximum hit points increase by 1 for each level you have in this class.
You gain darkvision out to a distance of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet.
Each of your movement speeds increase by 5.
You have advantage on saving throws against disease and poison.
Your jump distances are tripled and you gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed.
When you make a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) ability check you can use your reaction to add a bonus to the roll. This bonus is equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiotic Sentinel
entries: Starting at 6th level, your patron remains alert to all threats to its host at all times. You cannot be surprised and you have advantage on Dexterity ability checks made to determine initiative. You also gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Spawn Pawn
entries: At 10th level, you learn the {@spell dominate person} spell. It counts as a warlock spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of spells you know. You can also cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

When you cast this spell, your patron enhances the magic, dealing psychic damage equal to your warlock level if the creature succeeds on a saving throw to end the spell. In addition, damage can't break your concentration on this spell.

subclassFeature.name: Larval Regeneration
entries: Starting when you reach 14th level, when you die, a larval parasite bursts from your corpse the next turn on your initiative. You control the parasite, which disappears after 24 hours. The parasite is a Tiny creature, has an AC of 14, maximum hit points equal to half your maximum hit points, and a walking speed of 30 feet. It otherwise uses your statistics but cannot cast spells.

As an action, the parasite can cause a creature within 5 feet of it to make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (your choice) against your warlock spell save DC. On a failure, the parasite burrows into the creature dealing piercing damage equal to your warlock level. While burrowed inside a creature, the parasite cannot take any actions, cannot be targeted by attacks, and is immune to all damage except psychic damage.

On each of the creature's subsequent turns it can use its action to make a Constitution saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. If the creature succeeds, the parasite is ejected from its body and into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice within 5 feet of it. If the parasite is still burrowed inside the creature when its turn ends, the creature takes necrotic damage equal to twice your warlock level. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, it immediately dies, the parasite disappears, and you take over the body of the humanoid as if you had been targeted by the {@spell reincarnate} spell and rolled the race the humanoid had been.
If you are returned to life, such as by the {@spell revivify} spell, your parasite immediately disappears. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Plague Doctor
entries: Blending spellcasting with science, you distill your magic into concoctions that harm or heal. Plague Doctors often wear grotesque masks protecting them from toxic ingredients. Many regard the mask with fear as a sign of pestilence, making Plague Doctors a source of both hope and trepidation.

subclassFeature.name: Potion Craft
entries: Beginning when you select this arcane tradition at 2nd level, you gain proficiency in {@skill Medicine} and with {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} and {@item herbalism kits|PHB}.

Additionally, you have learned to create magical concoctions. You can create any number of concoctions using your {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB}s or {@item herbalism kits|PHB} for 10 minutes, expending a spell slot for each concoction created. When you do, for each concoction created, choose a spell from your wizard's spell book that targets only one creature. The chosen spell must be of an equal or lower level than the expended spell slot.

When a creature consumes the concoction, it becomes the target of the spell as if you had just cast it. If the spell requires concentration, the creature that consumes the potion needs to concentrate on it. Concoctions created this way lose their magical effect at the end of your next long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Good Medicine
entries: Also at 2nd level, when you craft a concoction, you can choose to expend a spell slot without choosing a spell, instead creating good medicine. When a creature consumes your good medicine, you roll {@condition 1d8} per level of the spell slot expended casting the spell, and the creature regains an equal number of hit points. If you expended a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you also end all diseases afflicting the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Bad Medicine
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you craft a concoction you can choose to expend a spell slot without choosing a spell, instead crafting bad medicine. When you create a dose of bad medicine, choose one effect per level of spell slot expended.

items: The creature is {@condition poisoned}.
The creature's movement speeds are halved.
The creature takes an additional {@dice 1d4} necrotic damage the first time it takes damage each turn.
The creature takes {@dice 1d6} poison damage each time it takes an action, bonus action, or reaction on a turn.
The creature takes acid damage equal to the level of the spell slot expended at the start of each of its turns.

entries: As an action, you can hurl a dose of bad medicine at a point you can see within 30 feet. Creatures within 10 feet of that point must make a Constitution saving throw against your wizard spell save DC. On a failure, the creature suffers all of the chosen effects for the next minute.
As an action, the affected creature can attempt another Constitution saving throw to end any effects early.

subclassFeature.name: Breathe It In
entries: Beginning at 10th level, being persistently exposed to the most deadly ailments known has given you some small measure of resistance to them. After you take necrotic or poison damage, you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage. In addition, you are immune to disease and have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

subclassFeature.name: Medicinal Master
entries: Starting at 14th level, when you heal with your Good Medicine or deal damage with your Bad Medicine, roll an additional {@dice 2d8} to determine the amount of hit points regained or necrotic damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: School of Sangromancy
entries: You study an uncommon subschool of magic known as sangromancy or blood magic. Despite its dark reputation, there's nothing inherently evil about the practice of sangromancy, though its demands on its practitioners are gruesome. As a sangromancer, your chosen magic demands more than knowledge—it demands sacrifice as well. Other wizards may view you with skepticism or even outright hostility, but none can deny the potency of your art.

subclassFeature.name: Sangromancy Savant
entries: Beginning when you select this arcane tradition at 2nd level, all sangromancy spells are added to the wizard spell list for you. In addition, the gold and time you must spend to copy a sangromancy spell into your spellbook is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Full-Blooded
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you gain a pool of {@dice d12}s that you can expend instead of a hit die when you cast sangromancy spells. The number of dice in the pool equals 1 + your wizard level.
Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sanguine Vigor
entries: Starting at 6th level, your hit point maximum increases by 6 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.
In addition, when you cast a sangromancy spell, you regain a number of hit points equal to the level of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Blood for Blood
entries: At 10th level, when you deal damage to a creature with a spell you cast, you can expend and roll a hit die, or a {@dice d12} from your Full-Blooded feature, to add its result to the damage dealt to that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Red Renewal
entries: Starting at 14th level, when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended hit dice to recover. When you do, choose a number of expended hit dice equal to half your wizard level and regain them. You regain an equivalent number of dice from your Full Blooded feature. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Applied Leverage
entries: When you make a Strength ({@dice Athletics}) check to force open a door or container, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Camper
entries: When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check to construct a temporary shelter, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Charity Case
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check to fake an illness, injury, or other condition, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Looter
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) roll to find hidden valuables, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Pitiable
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check to convince an Aristocrat, Criminal, Militarist, or Clergy that you are not a threat or beneath their notice, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Solidarity
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check and you are interacting with members of your background, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Sticky Fingers
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check to snatch something quickly, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Temperature Tolerance
entries: When you make a Constitution saving throw to avoid {@condition exhaustion} due to extreme temperatures, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Tree Springer
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check to ascend, descend, or travel between trees, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Vacant Expression
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check to feign ignorance and you are interacting with an Academic, Aristocrat, Clergy, or Militarist, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Form
entries: Il punteggio di Carisma aumenta di 2 e quello di Destrezza di 1. Un punteggio di abilità non può essere aumentato oltre 16 in questo modo. Diventate anche fey, oltre a tutti gli altri tipi di creature che siete. Gli incantesimi che colpiscono gli umanoidi hanno comunque effetto su di voi. Tuttavia, siete immuni agli effetti che colpiscono solo una creatura del vostro nuovo tipo con una CR specifica.
Quando si ottiene questa capacità, si deve anche scegliere quale corte Fey alimenta la trasformazione. Scegliete una delle seguenti:

entries.name: The Summer Court
entries: La corte estiva incarna la generosità e il calore della stagione di crescita. I fey dell'estate tendono alla giovialità, alla volubilità e alla vanità. Le creature dell'estate spesso nascondono le loro intenzioni crudeli dietro belle facciate.

entries.name: The Winter Court
entries: La corte invernale incarna l'immobilità e l'oscurità della stagione più fredda. I Fey dell'inverno tendono a essere seri, crudeli e riflessivi. Le creature dell'inverno sono spesso terrificanti da vedere, ma molto dirette nelle loro intenzioni.

optionalfeature.name: Twilight Step
entries: Come azione bonus, puoi teletrasportarti magicamente fino a 9 metri in uno spazio non occupato che riesci a vedere. Il passo del crepuscolo guadagna anche una caratteristica aggiuntiva, a seconda della corte scelta per l'abilità Forma Fey.

entries.name: Summer
entries: Subito dopo aver usato il passo del crepuscolo, una creatura a scelta che si può vedere entro un raggio di 2 metri subisce danni da fuoco pari al proprio modificatore di Carisma (minimo 1 danno).

entries.name: Winter
entries: Subito dopo aver usato il passo del crepuscolo, una creatura a scelta che si può vedere entro un raggio di 2 metri subisce danni da freddo pari al proprio modificatore di Carisma (minimo 1 danno).
Si può usare la caratteristica Passo crepuscolare un numero di volte pari al proprio modificatore di Carisma (minimo una volta). Si riacquistano tutti gli usi spesi al termine di un riposo lungo.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Binding
entries: Il tuo corpo e la tua anima sono legati a uno dei regni delle fate. Avete svantaggio sui tiri salvezza per la morte quando il regno tenta di riportarvi al suo interno. Se venite uccisi, la vostra anima viene riportata su un piano di esistenza a scelta del GM. Questo piano è la vostra nuova casa e diventate un PNG sotto il controllo del GM.
Se ci si trova nel regno delle fate responsabile della trasformazione, questo difetto non ha effetto.

optionalfeature.name: Two-Faced
entries: Si può scegliere di trasformare il proprio volto in una visione di incantevole bellezza o di orribile bruttezza. Qualsiasi creatura non fey entro 9 metri da voi quando trasformate il vostro volto deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Saggezza o subire l'effetto per 1 minuto.

entries.name: Summer
entries: Ogni creatura che fallisce il tiro salvezza diventa {@condition charmed}. Questo effetto termina in anticipo su una creatura se voi o un vostro alleato le infliggete danno o intraprendete altre azioni dannose.

entries.name: Winter
entries: Ogni creatura che fallisce il tiro salvezza diventa {@condition frightened} di voi. Questo effetto termina in anticipo se una creatura colpita da questa abilità termina il suo turno fuori dalla vostra linea di vista.
Si può usare questa caratteristica un numero di volte pari al proprio modificatore di Carisma (minimo una volta). si riacquistano tutti gli usi spesi al termine di un riposo lungo.

optionalfeature.name: Sprite Servant
entries: Un folletto fey si lega al vostro servizio. Il folletto è una sfera di luce fluttuante, considerata come una creatura minuscola che non può essere danneggiata o influenzata in alcun modo. Il folletto ha le seguenti caratteristiche:

items: Il folletto ha una velocità di volo di 10 metri.
Il folletto non può parlare verbalmente, ma può comunicare telepaticamente con voi finché si trova nel raggio di un miglio da voi. Il folletto capisce tutte le lingue che voi conoscete.

Il folletto può diventare invisibile a volontà. Altrimenti, diffonde una luce fioca in un raggio di 3 metri. Come azione bonus, si può comandare al folletto di brillare di più. Seguendo questo comando, il folletto può diffondere luce brillante in un raggio di 6 metri e luce fioca per altri 6 metri.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Tricks
entries: La trasformazione conferisce un potere innato che si manifesta con la capacità di lanciare un piccolo numero di incantesimi. Si impara un cantrip di illusione o incantesimo.

Inoltre, sceglierne uno {@filter 1st-level and one 2nd-level illusion or enchantment spell|spells|level=1,2|school=I,E}. È possibile lanciare ciascuno di questi incantesimi una volta senza spendere uno slot incantesimo. Si riacquista la capacità di lanciarli in questo modo al termine di un riposo breve o lungo. Il Carisma è la capacità di lancio di questi incantesimi. Al termine di un riposo lungo, si può sostituire l'incantesimo di 1° o 2° livello con un incantesimo dello stesso livello, che deve essere anche un incantesimo di incantesimo o di illusione.

optionalfeature.name: Queen's Servant
entries: La corte fey vi presta il suo potere e in cambio dovete pagare regolarmente un tributo per mantenere la vostra libertà. Due volte all'anno, al solstizio d'inverno e d'estate, dovete consegnare un tesoro o un altro tributo significativo alla regina d'inverno o a quella d'estate (a cui siete fedeli). Se non consegnate il tributo entro il giorno stabilito, la vostra regina vi trascina immediatamente nel suo regno fatato.

Una volta attirati in questo modo, dovrete rimanere nel regno delle fate per 100 anni, o finché non stringerete un patto con la regina per farvi tornare sul piano mortale. Il vostro GM vi dirà cosa costituisce un tributo appropriato per la corte. Alcune regine fey preferiscono oggetti magici, mentre altre desiderano segreti a lungo custoditi, la cattura di criminali fey o servitori umanoidi.

optionalfeature.name: Faerie Mantle
entries: Potete usare un'azione per avvolgervi nella maestosità della fata per 1 minuto. Durante questo periodo, proiettate un'aura di bellezza accecante fino a una distanza di 9 metri. Quando le creature a vostra scelta iniziano il loro turno o si muovono in quest'aura, devono superare un tiro salvezza di Carisma o subire {@condition blinded} per 1 minuto. Una creatura {@condition blinded} in questo modo può ripetere il tiro salvezza alla fine di ogni suo turno, ponendo fine alla condizione {@condition blinded} in caso di successo. Una volta utilizzata questa azione, non è possibile farlo di nuovo finché non si termina un riposo lungo.

optionalfeature.name: Made of Magic
entries: La trasformazione in un Fey ha cambiato la natura fondamentale del vostro corpo. Guadagnate resistenza ai danni degli incantesimi.

Inoltre, quando si effettua un tiro salvezza contro un incantesimo, si può usare una reazione per ottenere un vantaggio sul tiro. Una volta che si usa questa reazione, non è possibile farlo di nuovo finché non si termina un riposo breve o lungo.

optionalfeature.name: Courtly Graces
entries: Si acquisisce la competenza in due abilità determinate dalla propria corte. Se si è già abili in una o entrambe le abilità, il bonus di competenza viene raddoppiato per le prove di abilità che utilizzano quell'abilità. Se si ha o si otterrà un bonus di competenza doppio in una o entrambe le abilità, si otterrà un ulteriore +2 per quell'abilità.
Inoltre, la fedeltà a una corte fey offre protezione da alcune emozioni associate alla corte. Ottenete un beneficio in base alla vostra corte.

entries.name: Summer
entries: Si acquisisce competenza in {@skill Performance} e {@skill Persuasion} e si è immuni all'essere {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Winter
entries: Si acquisisce competenza in {@skill Deception} e {@skill Intimidation} e si è immuni all'essere {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Bound by Words
entries: I Fey scelgono con cura le loro parole, perché sono vincolati da esse, e lo stesso vale per voi. Quando date la vostra parola a una creatura umanoide (ad esempio facendo una promessa o un impegno, stipulando un contratto o giungendo a un accordo verbale) l'impegno diventa magicamente vincolante. Se non rispettate la vostra parte dell'accordo, perdete i benefici di tutti i vostri vantaggi della trasformazione fey fino a quando non consegnate un'ulteriore decima alla regina dell'estate o dell'inverno, come descritto nel vostro difetto Comando della Regina. Questa decima si aggiunge a quelle richieste da quel difetto.

È importante notare che si è vincolati dalla lettera di qualsiasi accordo stipulato, non dallo spirito. Se promettete di non toccare il principe, per esempio, non ci saranno conseguenze se lo prenderete a calci (a patto che la vostra mano non lo tocchi).

optionalfeature.name: Greater Magic Tricks
entries: Scegliere un {@filter enchantment or illusion spell of 3rd, 4th, and 5th level|spells|school=E,I|level=3,4,5}. Si può lanciare ognuno di questi incantesimi una volta senza spendere uno slot incantesimo e si riacquista la capacità di lanciarli in questo modo al termine di un riposo lungo. Il Carisma è la capacità di lancio di questi incantesimi. Al termine di un riposo lungo, è possibile sostituire un incantesimo di 3°, 4° o 5° livello con un incantesimo dello stesso livello, che deve essere anche un incantesimo di incantesimo o di illusione.

optionalfeature.name: Misdirection
entries: La luce e la magia si piegano stranamente intorno a te, rendendoti difficile da colpire. Tutti i tiri di attacco contro di voi hanno svantaggio. Se si viene colpiti da un attacco, questo tratto viene interrotto fino alla fine del turno successivo. Questo tratto funziona solo quando si è coscienti.

optionalfeature.name: Twilight Glamour
entries: Come azione, potete diventare {@condition invisible}. Anche tutto ciò che si indossa o si porta addosso diventa {@condition invisible}. L'invisibilità termina se si sceglie di terminarla, se si attacca o se si lancia un incantesimo. Una volta che l'invisibilità termina in questo modo, non si può usare di nuovo questa caratteristica per 1 minuto. Questo tratto funziona solo quando si è coscienti.

optionalfeature.name: Seasonally Affected
entries: Il vostro legame con le corti fey vi ha conferito un enorme potere, ma anche un'esoterica fragilità: ottenete una debolezza ai danni da freddo se siete nella corte estiva, o ai danni da fuoco se siete nella corte invernale.

Se normalmente si era resistenti a questo tipo di danno, il danno viene inflitto normalmente. Se normalmente si è immuni ai danni di questo tipo, si è invece resistenti. Inoltre, ogni volta che si subisce un danno di questo tipo, i punti ferita massimi si riducono di pari entità. Quando i punti ferita massimi sono ridotti da questo effetto, tornano normali al termine di un riposo lungo.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Form
entries: La Costituzione aumenta di 2 e la Saggezza di 1. Un punteggio di abilità non può essere aumentato oltre 16 in questo modo.
Diventate un Elementale in aggiunta agli altri tipi di creature che siete. Gli incantesimi e le abilità che influenzano gli Elementali di una specifica CR non hanno effetto su di voi.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial Affinity
entries: Pur essendo in grado di controllare tutti gli elementi, la vostra nascita primordiale è stata innescata da un elemento particolare: la vostra Affinità Primordiale. Il vostro corpo è infuso di energia elementale malleabile. Dovete scegliere un elemento qui sotto e ottenere tutti i benefici di quell'elemento:

entries.name: Air
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da fulmine. Inoltre, è possibile incanalare le correnti d'aria intorno a sé per guidare un attacco a distanza. Una volta per ogni turno, quando si effettua un attacco con armi a distanza o incantesimi a distanza, si può effettuare l'attacco con vantaggio. Se ci si trova in un luogo privo di correnti d'aria, ad esempio sott'acqua, questa caratteristica non ha effetto.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da veleno. Inoltre, ogni volta che si guadagnano punti ferita temporanei, se ne guadagnano altrettanti più il proprio bonus di competenza.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da fuoco. Inoltre, ogni volta che infliggi danni da fuoco, puoi aggiungere il tuo modificatore di Costituzione ai danni inflitti.

entries.name: Water
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da freddo. Inoltre, ogni volta che una creatura recupera punti ferita a causa di un incantesimo o di una caratteristica da voi controllata, potete infondere in essa energia elementale curativa. La creatura recupera punti ferita aggiuntivi pari a {@dice 1d6} + il vostro modificatore di Costituzione.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Binding
entries: Il corpo e l'anima sono legati a un piano di esistenza primordiale. Avete svantaggio sui tiri salvezza per la morte quando il piano tenta di riportarvi al suo interno. Se venite uccisi, la vostra anima viene riportata su un piano di esistenza a scelta del GM. Questo piano è la vostra nuova casa e diventate un PNG sotto il controllo del GM.
Se siete sul piano primordiale responsabile della vostra trasformazione, questo difetto non ha effetto.

optionalfeature.name: Dual Nature
entries: Si può scegliere di aggiungere alla propria forma una seconda fonte elementale dal Tomo Affinità Primordiale. Quando lo si fa, si ottengono i benefici associati al nuovo elemento.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Surge
entries: Si può incanalare la pura energia elementale in un colpo concentrato di un elemento a scelta. Nel vostro turno, come azione potete scegliere una delle seguenti opzioni:

entries.name: Lightning Strike
entries: You can make a special ranged attack targeting a creature within 60 feet. You are proficient with this attack, which uses your Constitution modifier. On a hit, this attack deals {@dice 3d8} + your Constitution modifier lightning damage. You can then use a bonus action to target another creature with 30 feet of the first target with the same attack. Increase the damage by {@dice 1d8} for each transformation level about 2.

entries.name: Earth Shard
entries: You can force a creature within 30 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 3d6} + your Constitution modifier, or half as much on a successful save. Increase the damage by {@dice 1d6} for each transformation level about 2.
You also gain temporary hit points equal to half this amount.

entries.name: Flame Wave
entries: Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating in your square must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, creatures in the area take fire damage equal to {@dice 2d8} + your Constitution modifier. Increase the damage by {@dice 1d8} for each transformation level about 2.

entries.name: Aquatic Rejuvenation
entries: Choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 2d8} + your Constitution modifier. Increase the amount of hit points regained by {@dice 1d8} for each transformation level about 2.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all expended uses upon completing a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Call the Four
entries: You can use your action to summon or repel elemental forces around you, causing one of the following effects of your choice:

You create a 15-foot radius globe of breathable air around you. Creatures can pass freely in or out of the globe, but other elemental forces like water or fire cannot. Alternatively, you can choose to banish all air from inside the globe. This globe lasts for 10 minutes, and you must concentrate on it (as per concentrating to maintain a spell).

You can conjure up to 50 pounds of loose earth at a point within 30 feet of you. Alternatively, you can shape the earth and stone within 15 feet of you. If affecting dirt or stone on the ground, you can cause it to become difficult terrain.
All flammable objects not worn or wielded within 30 feet of you to burst into flame. Alternatively, all nonmagical flames within 30 feet of you are immediately extinguished.

You can conjure up to 10 gallons of water at a point within 30 feet of you or cause the water to fall like rain in a 30-foot area. Alternatively, you can choose to repel water within 15 feet of you. This ability has no effect on living creatures but repels mist, rain and creates pockets of air if submerged in water.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial: Hideous Appearance
entries: Your appearance has grotesquely transformed. Your eyes might be smoldering embers, water could continuously pour from your mouth or nose, your extremities may crumble like sand, or patches of your skin might fade to transparency. Regardless of your true form, you are horrific to behold. You can suspend this form and manifest the appearance of the humanoid you once were, but this is taxing and requires concentration.
This form is not permanent, and moments of stress are likely to reveal your true nature. Your true form is revealed in the following situations:

items: Concentrating on a spell.
Gaining the {@condition unconscious} condition.
Choosing to reveal yourself.
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM may call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you maintain your humanoid form.

entries: Non-chaotic creatures that witness your true form become hostile to you, unless the GM decides otherwise.

optionalfeature.name: Primeval Body
entries: Your transformation to an elemental form has changed your body entirely. You no longer need to sleep, breathe, or eat. You also gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Awakening
entries: You emit an aura of power that awakens the elemental forces in your companions. When you first gain this feature, choose one of the options below. You may change the aura you emit upon completing a long rest.

entries.name: Light as Air
entries: Whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you makes a Dexterity saving throw, the creature gains a bonus equal to your Constitution modifier. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

entries.name: Forged in Fire
entries: While you are conscious, whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you deals damage with a melee weapon attack, they deal additional fire damage equal to your Constitution modifier. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

entries.name: Heart of Stone
entries: At the beginning of your turn, you and each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier. While a creature has temporary hit points gained in this manner and are not incapacitated, they cannot be moved or knocked {@condition prone}, unless they choose to be. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

entries.name: Spring of Life
entries: Each unconscious creature of your choice within 10 feet of you regains 1 hit point at the beginning of their turn. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Many
entries: You can choose to add a third elemental source to your form. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element from Primordial Affinity in addition to your current source benefits.

optionalfeature.name: Force of Nature
entries: You are losing your connection to societal norms. The needs of civilization, community, and morals pale in comparison to the elemental chaos roiling within you. Whenever you complete a long rest, if you are within civilization, you do not regain any hit dice or lose any levels of exhaustion. In these circumstances, the GM decides if a location is considered civilized or not. Alternatively, the GM can decide that a park or grove within a city is sufficient.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Aura
entries: Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you gain resistance to lightning, fire, poison, and cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Flow
entries: As a bonus action, you can burst into a shower of elemental material then materialize somewhere else. You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying. Moving in this way does not provoke opportunity attacks. After teleporting, you can choose one of the following:

entries.name: Swift Assault
entries: You can immediately make a weapon attack. If you make a ranged attack, you do not have disadvantage if a hostile creature is within 5 feet.

entries.name: Spark Storm
entries: Each creature within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save creatures take {@dice 2d6} fire damage.

entries.name: Boulderous Hide
entries: Choose a damage type. Until the start of your next turn, you have resistance to that damage type.

entries.name: Sea Mother's Tether
entries: A thin tether of water links you to a creature within 30 feet. While tethered, if the creature would take damage, you can choose to take that damage instead. Additionally, if you would be damaged, the tethered creature can choose to take that damage instead. This damage cannot be reduced or prevented in any way.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier. You regain all expended uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Mastery
entries: You gain the fourth elemental source to your form. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element from Primordial Affinity.

Additionally, you can summon the four elements to wreath you in power. Whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force it to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 8d6} damage of a type of your choice from cold, fire, lightning or bludgeoning, or half as much on a successful save. Until the end of your following turn, your Primal Affinity feature has the following additions:

entries.name: Air
entries: You have advantage on all ranged weapon and ranged spell attacks instead of only one.

entries.name: Earth
entries: At the beginning of your turn you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your character level.

entries.name: Fire
entries: At the beginning of your turn, each creature of your choice within 5 feet of you takes {@dice 2d6} fire damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: Whenever a creature regains hit points due to a spell or feature you control that creature regains an additional number of hit points equal to your character level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all uses upon completing a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Pull of Chaos
entries: Your new native plane attempts to pull you to it, laying claim to your form. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a saving throw against a magical spell or ability, you take {@dice 1d6} force damage per two character levels in addition to any other damage or effects you would suffer, as your native plane attempts to unbind you from the Material Plane. For example, a 6th-level character would take {@dice 3d6} force damage. This damage ignores resistances and immunities.

optionalfeature.name: Spectral Presence
entries: Your Dexterity increases by 2 and your Charisma increases by 1. No ability score can increase above 16 in this way.
